message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study employs data from the Integrated Public Use Microdata Series International database and the Global Consumption and Income Project to investigate global income inequality trends.", "dataset": ["Integrated Public Use Microdata Series International database", "Global Consumption and Income Project"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "To understand the relationship between economic growth and disability prevalence, we utilize panel data from the World Health Organization and the World Bank's World Development Indicators database.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization", "World Bank's World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a longitudinal dataset of 1,164 rural Mexican households compiled by the Mexican Family Life Survey to examine the impact of educational attainment on subsequent income generation.", "dataset": ["Mexican Family Life Survey"], "topic": ["Education", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and the European Space Agency's Climate Change Initiative, we examine the effects of climate change on ocean temperatures and coral reef health in the Caribbean.", "dataset": ["National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration", "European Space Agency's Climate Change Initiative"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We use a mixed-methods approach, combining qualitative interviews with a nationally representative quantitative survey conducted by the World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture to evaluate the impact of vaccination programs on livestock productivity in Tanzania.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyzes data from the World Values Survey, the European Social Survey, and the Eurobarometer to investigate the relationship between social trust and populist attitudes in Europe.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "European Social Survey", "Eurobarometer"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of satellite imagery and administrative data from the China Ministry of Agriculture to analyze the impact of land tenure reforms on smallholder farmers' use of agrochemicals.", "dataset": ["China Ministry of Agriculture"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the effect of access to credit on firm-level innovation, we utilize data from the World Bank's Enterprise Survey and Credit Reporting Agencies in Brazil.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Survey", "Credit Reporting Agencies"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines publicly available population density data and proprietary geospatial information from telecommunications companies to evaluate the effectiveness of mobile money adoption in reducing poverty in Niger.", "dataset": ["population density data", "proprietary geospatial information from telecommunications companies"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the United Nations Integrated Phase Classification and FAOSTAT to understand how climate shocks affect the food security of pastoralists in East Africa.", "dataset": ["United Nations Integrated Phase Classification", "FAOSTAT"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}]
